lines.text: So you're quite sure of your feelings? I mean, you know, sometimes people get... carried away, come to their senses again with a jolt.
Mr. Lannington, I wanna marry your daughter.
I wish you'd stop calling her my daughter. She happens to be my wife!

[drinking a cocktail in a Hawaiian restaurant]
These things are like water!
They creep up on you.

[derisively]
Bring me a couple more.
But, sir, you have four and we are only allowed two to a customer.
Why?
That drink makes a guy talk back to his mother-in-law.
What about his father-in-law?
I suppose so.
You've given me an idea.
If you take her, it's a long road! There's no turning back!
Oh, Jeff, take me away now!
'Now' can be a long time, Dr. Cameron, but time passes, and then there's the end of the line!

[rubbing his head]
My head hurts. Feels like it's exploding.
[looking out the car window]
Aren't we going pretty fast?
We need to go fast!
Poverty's sordid!
I won't leave you. I'll be with you always.
Yeah, well, 'always' won't be for long if we don't get rid of this car!
Nobody pities me - nobody!
If you ask me, that guy was none too anxious to get hitched.
How many of them are?
It all fits in, all the symptoms. I didn't fall in love with a woman - I fell in love with a patient.
A wacky dame like that's likely to do anything.
